intro: Quercus handeliana, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its ecological importance makes it a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
